**Warwick Ashley Davis** (born 3 February 1970)[2] is an English actor,
television presenter, writer, director and producer.[3] He played the title
characters in _[Willow](/wiki/Willow_\(film\) "Willow \(film\)")_ and the
[_Leprechaun_ film series](/wiki/Leprechaun_\(film_series\) "Leprechaun \(film
series\)"), the [Ewok](/wiki/Ewok "Ewok") [Wicket](/wiki/Wicket_W._Warrick
"Wicket W. Warrick") in _[Star Wars Episode VI: Return of the
Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Jedi "Return of the Jedi")_ and [Professor Filius
Flitwick](/wiki/Filius_Flitwick "Filius Flitwick") and
[Griphook](/wiki/Griphook "Griphook") in the _[Harry
Potter](/wiki/Harry_Potter_\(film_series\) "Harry Potter \(film series\)")_
films. Davis also starred as a fictionalised version of himself in the sitcom
_[Life's Too Short](/wiki/Life%27s_Too_Short_\(TV_series\) "Life's Too Short
\(TV series\)")_, written and directed by [Ricky Gervais](/wiki/Ricky_Gervais
"Ricky Gervais") and [Stephen Merchant](/wiki/Stephen_Merchant "Stephen
Merchant").

He has presented [ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_network\) "ITV \(TV network\)") game
shows _[Celebrity Squares](/wiki/Celebrity_Squares "Celebrity Squares")_
(2014–2015) and _[Tenable](/wiki/Tenable "Tenable")_ (2016–present).

## Early
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Warwick_Davis&action=edit&section=1&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Early life")]

Davis was born in [Epsom](/wiki/Epsom "Epsom"), Surrey, the son of Susan and
Ashley Davis, an insurance worker.[4][5] Davis has a younger sister. He was
educated at [Chinthurst School](/wiki/Chinthurst_School "Chinthurst School")
and later the [City of London Freemen's
School](/wiki/City_of_London_Freemen%27s_School "City of London Freemen's
School"). Davis was born with [Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia
congenita](/wiki/Spondyloepiphyseal_dysplasia_congenita "Spondyloepiphyseal
dysplasia congenita"), an extremely rare form of [dwarfism](/wiki/Dwarfism
"Dwarfism"). When Davis was 11, his grandmother heard a radio advert calling
for people who were 4 feet (1.2 m) tall or shorter to be in _[Return of the
Jedi](/wiki/Return_of_the_Jedi "Return of the Jedi")_.[6] To Davis, who was a
fan of the _[Star Wars](/wiki/Star_Wars "Star Wars")_ films, it was a dream
come true. During the filming of _Return of the Jedi_ , [Mark
Hamill](/wiki/Mark_Hamill "Mark Hamill") bought Davis every _Star Wars_ figure
he did not have.[3]

##
Career[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Warwick_Davis&action=edit&section=2&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Career")]

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/58/Warwick_Davis_%26_Anthony_Daniels_2.jpg/170px-
Warwick_Davis_%26_Anthony_Daniels_2.jpg)](/wiki/File:Warwick_Davis_%26_Anthony_Daniels_2.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Warwick_Davis_%26_Anthony_Daniels_2.jpg "Enlarge")

Davis with fellow _Star Wars_ actor [Anthony Daniels](/wiki/Anthony_Daniels
"Anthony Daniels") ([C-3PO](/wiki/C-3PO "C-3PO")) in 2010

Davis was originally cast as an extra [Ewok](/wiki/Ewok "Ewok"), but when
[Kenny Baker](/wiki/Kenny_Baker_\(English_actor\) "Kenny Baker \(English
actor\)"), who was originally going to be [Wicket](/wiki/Wicket_W._Warrick
"Wicket W. Warrick"), fell ill, [George Lucas](/wiki/George_Lucas "George
Lucas") picked Davis to be the new Wicket after seeing how he carried himself
as an Ewok.[4]

Davis based his Ewok movements on his dog, who would tilt his head from side
to side whenever he saw something strange. During production on the film,
Davis was the subject of a short [mockumentary](/wiki/Mockumentary
"Mockumentary") film about his experience as Wicket, titled _[Return of the
Ewok](/wiki/Return_of_the_Ewok "Return of the Ewok")_ , made by _Return of the
Jedi_ 's first assistant director, [David Tomblin](/wiki/David_Tomblin "David
Tomblin"). The unreleased film was a fictional look at his decision to become
an actor and act in the film and his transformation into Wicket the Ewok.
Davis reprised his role as Wicket in the
[ABC](/wiki/American_Broadcasting_Company "American Broadcasting Company")
made-for-TV films _[Caravan of Courage: An Ewok
Adventure](/wiki/Caravan_of_Courage:_An_Ewok_Adventure "Caravan of Courage: An
Ewok Adventure")_ and _[Ewoks: The Battle for
Endor](/wiki/Ewoks:_The_Battle_for_Endor "Ewoks: The Battle for Endor")_.

In 1987, Davis was called to [Elstree
Studios](/wiki/Elstree_Studios_\(Shenley_Road\) "Elstree Studios \(Shenley
Road\)") near London to meet with [Ron Howard](/wiki/Ron_Howard "Ron Howard")
and George Lucas to discuss a new film project called
_[Willow](/wiki/Willow_\(film\) "Willow \(film\)")_ , which was written with
Davis specifically in mind. _Willow_ was his first opportunity to act with his
face visible. He co-starred with [Val Kilmer](/wiki/Val_Kilmer "Val Kilmer")
in the film, which received a Royal Premiere before the
[Prince](/wiki/Charles,_Prince_of_Wales "Charles, Prince of Wales") and
[Princess of Wales](/wiki/Diana_Spencer "Diana Spencer"). He then moved to
television to be in the [BBC Television](/wiki/BBC_Television "BBC
Television") adaptation of the classic _[The Chronicles of
Narnia](/wiki/The_Chronicles_of_Narnia_\(TV_serial\) "The Chronicles of Narnia
\(TV serial\)")_ , specifically in _[Prince Caspian](/wiki/Prince_Caspian
"Prince Caspian")_ , _[The Voyage of the Dawn
Treader](/wiki/The_Voyage_of_the_Dawn_Treader "The Voyage of the Dawn
Treader")_ (as [Reepicheep](/wiki/Reepicheep "Reepicheep")), and _[The Silver
Chair](/wiki/The_Silver_Chair "The Silver Chair")_ (as
[Glimfeather](/wiki/Glimfeather "Glimfeather")) and an episode of
_[Zorro](/wiki/Zorro_\(1990_TV_series\) "Zorro \(1990 TV series\)")_ filmed in
[Madrid](/wiki/Madrid "Madrid"). In 1993, he played the villainous Irish
goblin in _[Leprechaun](/wiki/Leprechaun_\(film\) "Leprechaun \(film\)")_ ,
alongside [Jennifer Aniston](/wiki/Jennifer_Aniston "Jennifer Aniston"). He
then returned to the _Star Wars_ universe, playing three roles in _[Star Wars:
Episode I – The Phantom
Menace](/wiki/Star_Wars:_Episode_I_%E2%80%93_The_Phantom_Menace "Star Wars:
Episode I – The Phantom Menace")_ : Weazel, a gambler sitting next to Watto at
the Podrace; [Wald](/wiki/List_of_Star_Wars_Old_Republic_characters#Wald "List
of Star Wars Old Republic characters"), who was Anakin's Rodian friend; and
[Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda") in some scenes where Yoda was seen walking.

Davis played the role of Professor [Filius Flitwick](/wiki/Filius_Flitwick
"Filius Flitwick") in the _[Harry Potter](/wiki/Harry_Potter "Harry Potter")_
films.[7] Davis played a white-moustached Flitwick in the first two films, and
then a black-haired unnamed chorus conductor for the third instalment of the
series. In the fourth film, Flitwick is younger looking, with short, brown
hair and a trimmed moustache. In addition to playing Flitwick, Davis played
the role of the goblin Griphook in _[Harry Potter and the Deathly
Hallows](/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows_\(films\) "Harry Potter
and the Deathly Hallows \(films\)")_ , despite the role being played
previously by fellow dwarf actor [Verne Troyer](/wiki/Verne_Troyer "Verne
Troyer").

In 2004, Davis played the character "Plates" in the indie film _[Skinned
Deep](/wiki/Skinned_Deep "Skinned Deep")_ , directed by special effects artist
Gabriel Bartalos. In 2006, Davis appeared, alongside fellow _Harry Potter_
star [Daniel Radcliffe](/wiki/Daniel_Radcliffe "Daniel Radcliffe"), in an
episode of BBC's comedy series _[Extras](/wiki/Extras_\(TV_series\) "Extras
\(TV series\)")_ as a satirical version of himself. Davis starred in the film
version of _[The Hitchhiker's Guide to the
Galaxy](/wiki/The_Hitchhiker%27s_Guide_to_the_Galaxy_\(film\) "The
Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy \(film\)")_, as the "body" of [Marvin the
Paranoid Android](/wiki/Marvin_the_Paranoid_Android "Marvin the Paranoid
Android") (the voice was provided by [Alan Rickman](/wiki/Alan_Rickman "Alan
Rickman")). In December 2006, Davis starred in the [pantomime](/wiki/Pantomime
"Pantomime") _[Snow White and the Seven Dwarves](/wiki/Snow_White "Snow
White")_ at the [Opera House](/wiki/Manchester_Opera_House "Manchester Opera
House"), Manchester, and again in 2007–08 at the [New Wimbledon
Theatre](/wiki/New_Wimbledon_Theatre "New Wimbledon Theatre").

Davis appeared in _[The Chronicles of Narnia: Prince
Caspian](/wiki/The_Chronicles_of_Narnia:_Prince_Caspian "The Chronicles of
Narnia: Prince Caspian")_ , in which he played [Nikabrik the
Dwarf](/wiki/Nikabrik "Nikabrik"), adding to his previous involvement in TV
adaptations of the _Chronicles of Narnia_ series. He also appeared as a
contestant on the 2007 series of [Children in Need](/wiki/Children_in_Need
"Children in Need") reality show [Celebrity
Scissorhands](/wiki/Celebrity_Scissorhands "Celebrity Scissorhands"). Davis
starred as a fictional version of himself in _[Life's Too
Short](/wiki/Life%27s_Too_Short_\(TV_series\) "Life's Too Short \(TV
series\)")_, written by [Ricky Gervais](/wiki/Ricky_Gervais "Ricky Gervais")
and [Stephen Merchant](/wiki/Stephen_Merchant "Stephen Merchant"), who also
starred.[8] In December 2012, Davis returned to [New Wimbledon
Theatre](/wiki/New_Wimbledon_Theatre "New Wimbledon Theatre") to reprise his
role in _[Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs](/wiki/Snow_White "Snow White")_.[9]

In March 2013, Davis presented an episode of the
[ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_network\) "ITV \(TV network\)") series _Perspectives_ :
_Warwick Davis – The Seven Dwarfs of Auschwitz_ , in which he explored the
story of the [Ovitz family](/wiki/Ovitz_family "Ovitz family"), a touring
musical troupe which included seven dwarfs who survived the
[Nazi](/wiki/Nazism "Nazism") [Auschwitz concentration
camp](/wiki/Auschwitz_concentration_camp "Auschwitz concentration camp") and
the experiments of [Josef Mengele](/wiki/Josef_Mengele "Josef
Mengele").[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

In late 2013, Davis appeared for one month as Patsy in the musical comedy
_[Spamalot](/wiki/Spamalot "Spamalot")_ , based on the film _[Monty Python and
the Holy Grail](/wiki/Monty_Python_and_the_Holy_Grail "Monty Python and the
Holy Grail")_ in London,[10] At the same time, Davis hosted a press conference
to announce the Monty Python reunion.[11]

In 2014, Davis hosted a factual series for [ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_network\) "ITV
\(TV network\)") called _[Weekend Escapes with Warwick
Davis](/wiki/Weekend_Escapes_with_Warwick_Davis "Weekend Escapes with Warwick
Davis")_. The show saw Davis and his family travelling around Britain,
enjoying short weekend holiday breaks.[12] The show returned for a second
series in spring 2015. From 2014-15, he hosted the revived version of game
show _[Celebrity Squares](/wiki/Celebrity_Squares "Celebrity Squares")_ on
[ITV](/wiki/ITV_\(TV_network\) "ITV \(TV network\)"). The first series was
shown in 2014 and a second aired in 2015.[13]

Davis appeared in the 2015 sequel _[Star Wars: The Force
Awakens](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Force_Awakens "Star Wars: The Force
Awakens")_.[14] In July 2015, he became the voice of [Gordon the
Gopher](/wiki/Gordon_the_Gopher "Gordon the Gopher") in a pilot developed for
BBC Taster, and the pilot progressed well, becoming one of the highest rated
on the BBC's Taster section.[15][16]

Davis confirmed that he will appear in _[Star Wars: The Last
Jedi](/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Last_Jedi "Star Wars: The Last Jedi")_ in a to be
determined role. The film was released in December 2017.[17]

In November 2016, Davis began presenting the daytime ITV game show
_[Tenable](/wiki/Tenable "Tenable")_. The show will return for three further
series in 2017 and 2018.[18]

In April 2017, at [Star Wars Celebration](/wiki/Star_Wars_Celebration "Star
Wars Celebration") Orlando, it was announced that Davis would play [Grand
Admiral Thrawn](/wiki/Grand_Admiral_Thrawn "Grand Admiral Thrawn")'s bodyguard
Ruhk in the fourth season of _[Star Wars Rebels](/wiki/Star_Wars_Rebels "Star
Wars Rebels")_.[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

On 26 July 2017 it was announced that Davis will be appearing in the upcoming
film, _[Solo: A Star Wars Story](/wiki/Solo:_A_Star_Wars_Story "Solo: A Star
Wars Story")_ , that will reunite him with his _Willow_ director Ron Howard.
The film is set for release in May 2018. This will be the eighth appearance
for Davis in a _Star Wars_ film.[19]

### Other
projects[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Warwick_Davis&action=edit&section=3&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Other projects")]

In addition to his acting career, in 1995, Davis co-founded, with fellow dwarf
actor and father-in-law Peter Burroughs, the talent agency Willow Management,
that specialises in representing actors under five feet (1.52 m) tall. Many of
Davis's co-stars and fellow dwarf actors from _Star Wars_ , _Willow_ ,
_Labyrinth_ and the _Harry Potter_ series are represented by the agency. In
2004, the agency also began representing actors over seven feet (2.13 m) tall
who had suffered from being confined to "niche" roles. Over forty members of
Willow Management were cast as goblins in _[Harry Potter and the Deathly
Hallows – Part 2](/wiki/Harry_Potter_and_the_Deathly_Hallows_%E2%80%93_Part_2
"Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2")_.[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

In April 2010, Davis published his [autobiography](/wiki/Autobiography
"Autobiography"), _Size Matters Not: The Extraordinary Life and Career of
Warwick Davis_ , with a foreword by [George Lucas](/wiki/George_Lucas "George
Lucas").[20]

In January 2013, he appeared in a [Comic Relief](/wiki/Comic_Relief "Comic
Relief") episode of _[The Great British Bake
Off](/wiki/The_Great_British_Bake_Off "The Great British Bake Off")_ , winning
that episode's title of "Comic Relief Star Baker".[_[citation
needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

Davis is a founder of the Reduced Height Theatre Company, which stages
theatrical productions cast exclusively with short actors and using reduced
height sets. Their first production was _[See How They
Run](/wiki/See_How_They_Run_\(play\) "See How They Run \(play\)")_ , touring
the UK in 2014.[21] In February 2015, the production was the subject of the
BBC's "Warwick Davis' Big Night" as part of the _Modern Times_ documentary
series.[22]

In June 2016, he was the castaway on the [BBC Radio 4](/wiki/BBC_Radio_4 "BBC
Radio 4") programme _[Desert Island Discs](/wiki/Desert_Island_Discs "Desert
Island Discs")_.[23]

The [BBC](/wiki/BBC "BBC") broadcast an episode of _[Who Do You Think You
Are?](/wiki/Who_Do_You_Think_You_Are%3F_\(UK_TV_series\) "Who Do You Think You
Are? \(UK TV series\)")_ genealogy programmes on Warwick Davis in February
2017.[24] In the episode Davis learned that in his family tree he had an
ancestor that had been married to two women at the same time, another who had
died in an asylum from syphilis and another who performed as a minstrel in
[blackface](/wiki/Blackface "Blackface").[25]

## Personal
life[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Warwick_Davis&action=edit&section=4&editintro=Template:BLP_editintro
"Edit section: Personal life")]

Unlike most dwarfs (70.65%) who have a condition called
[achondroplasia](/wiki/Achondroplasia "Achondroplasia"), Davis' dwarfism is
caused by an extremely rare genetic condition called [spondyloepiphyseal
dysplasia congenita](/wiki/Spondyloepiphyseal_dysplasia_congenita
"Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia congenita") (SED). He has said the only real
drawback to being small was the associated health problems. Of his own
dwarfism, Davis has said, "As you get older, you can suffer from painful hips,
and our joints wear a lot quicker than for people of average
height."[_[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed
"Wikipedia:Citation needed")_]

Davis' wife, Samantha, has achondroplasia, and their two children also have
SED.[26] Their daughter, [Annabelle Davis](/wiki/Annabelle_Davis "Annabelle
Davis"), stars in the [CBBC](/wiki/CBBC "CBBC") show, _[The Dumping
Ground](/wiki/The_Dumping_Ground "The Dumping Ground")_ as Sasha Bellman. As a
result of having different causes of dwarfism, the couple's first two
children, sons Lloyd and George, died shortly after birth, having had a fatal
combination of the conditions. Samantha is the daughter of Davis' business
partner [Peter Burroughs](/wiki/Peter_Burroughs "Peter Burroughs") and the
sister of actress Hayley Burroughs. Davis met the Burroughs family while
filming _[Willow](/wiki/Willow_\(film\) "Willow \(film\)")_ , where Samantha
had a minor role as a Nelwyn villager.[27]
